intro: Buena gaudichaudiana, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 feet. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Buena gaudichaudiana thrives in tropical climates and is often found in coastal areas and moist lowlands.
